did.unittitle: New Bedford Women's Awareness Group records
did.abstract: The collection contains the weekly newsletter,"Rough Draft"(1977-78), of the New Bedford Women's Awareness Group, a consciousness-raising group, founded by former members of the New Bedford Women's Center. The newsletters include essays, poems, and announcements of upcoming events and activities.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for use without restriction beyond the standard terms and conditions of Smith College Special Collections.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The collection was received as a gift from Joann Aalfs in 2003.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The New Bedford Women's Awareness Group is a consciousness-raising group, founded by former members of the New Bedford Women's Center.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: New Bedford Women's Awareness Group records, Sophia Smith Collection, SSC-MS-00480, Smith College Special Collections, Northampton, Mass.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The first installment of this collection consists of one folder of the organizations weekly newsletter,"Rough Draft"(1977-78) which includes essays, poems, and announcements of upcoming events and activities, compiled and duplicated by Joann Aalfs.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: To the extent that she owns copyright, Joann Aalfs has assigned the copyright in her works to Smith College; however, copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For reproductions of materials that are governed by fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For instances which may regard materials in the collection not created by Aalfs, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights and obtaining approval from them. Researchers do not need anything further from Smith College Special Collections to move forward with their use.
